Customer Service Lead Job at Premium Human Resources Solution Limited




        
    

        
        Premium Human Resources Solution - Our client, a reputable and fast-growing AgriTech–FinTech company in Ado-Ekiti, Ekiti State, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Lead

Job Location: Ado-Ekiti - Ekiti
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Customer Service Lead to manage and enhance our customer support operations in Agrospace Agritech Fintech.
	The ideal candidate will oversee customer interactions, ensure service excellence, and contribute tobuilding trust and loyalty among our clients, including smallholder farmers. agri-businesses, and financial partners.
	The role involves developing strategies to improve customer satisfaction, leading a team of support staff, and using digital tools to deliver seamless customer experiences tailored to the needs of the agricultural and financial sectors.


Requirements


	Qualification: OND / HND / BSc in Business Administration, Agriculture, Finance, or a related field.
	Experience:1-2 years of experience in customer service.


Compensation
N83,000 - N102,000 + HMO, pension, and other benefits.

Note: Read instructions carefully!.

  "description": "Strickland Services Limited (SSL) is a fully indigenous, industry-leading Marine Logistics and Supply Services Company, renowned for delivering safe, reliable, and modern maritime solutions across the West African oil and gas sector. With a strong commitment to operational excellence, SSL provides a comprehensive portfolio of marine assets and support services designed to enhance offshore operations, improve efficiency, and ensure uninterrupted project execution.

Leveraging cutting-edge vessels, experienced personnel, and strict safety and compliance standards, SSL has built a reputation as a trusted partner to major oil and gas operators. The company&rsquo;s capabilities span marine transportation, offshore support services, supply boat operations, and specialized maritime logistics tailored to the unique demands of the energy industry. Through innovation, continuous improvement, and a deep understanding of local and international maritime requirements, Strickland Services Limited remains dedicated to advancing marine logistics in West Africa while contributing significantly to the growth and sustainability of the region&rsquo;s oil and gas value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager (Operations)
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Core Roles &amp; Responsibilities
Operational Leadership &amp; Strategy:


	Formulate and execute the organization&rsquo;s marine operations strategy in alignment with corporate objectives, regulatory frameworks, and client contractual requirements.
	Provide high-level technical oversight of vessel deployment to ensure fleet optimization, fuel efficiency, and cost-effective utilization of marine assets.
	Lead the coordination of multi-vessel operations to support offshore production, maintenance, and emergency response missions.


Regulatory &amp; Compliance Management:


	Enforce strict compliance with international maritime standards, including the ISM Code, MARPOL, SOLAS, and ISPS.
	Liaise with classification societies, flag states, and port authorities to ensure certification, statutory surveys, and audits are up to date.
	Champion a culture of continuous improvement in HSE performance, ensuring zero-harm operations and full regulatory adherence.


Technical &amp; Asset Oversight:


	Oversee technical condition, lifecycle maintenance, and reliability of all vessels in the fleet.
	Approve maintenance schedules, dry-docking plans, and CAPEX/OPEX budgets for fleet renewal and refurbishment.
	Collaborate with technical and engineering teams to implement advanced monitoring systems and predictive maintenance solutions.


Client Relations &amp; Stakeholder Management:


	Serve as the principal point of contact for major clients (IOCs, EPC contractors, and government agencies) on operational deliverables and performance evaluation.
	Negotiate and manage service-level agreements (SLAs), ensuring timely delivery and compliance with project KPIs.
	Represent the company at regulatory, industry, and client interface meetings to reinforce the organization&rsquo;s operational credibility.


Human Capital &amp; Crew Management:


	Supervise marine superintendents, technical managers, and vessel masters, ensuring adherence to operational policies and performance standards.
	Oversee crew competency development programs, including training, certification, and rotational planning to ensure skill retention and regulatory compliance.


Performance Optimization &amp; Digitalization:


	Drive the adoption of data analytics, AI-assisted fleet monitoring, and real-time operational dashboards for enhanced decision-making.
	Initiate continuous improvement initiatives, including root cause analysis of incidents and benchmarking against international best practices.
	Lead operational audits, vessel performance reviews, and client satisfaction assessments to identify areas for enhancement.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements
Academic &amp; Professional Credentials:


	Advanced degree (M.Sc., M.Eng., or equivalent) in Marine Engineering, Naval Architecture, Nautical Science, Offshore Operations Management, or a closely related discipline from a recognized institution.
	Completion of specialized executive programs in Maritime Operations Leadership, Offshore Asset Management, or Strategic Fleet Management is highly desirable.
	Mandatory possession of STCW Master/Chief Engineer certifications, including relevant endorsements for PSVs, AHTS, and FSIVs.


Experience &amp; Expertise:


	Minimum 15 years of progressive, demonstrable experience in offshore marine operations, with 10+ years in senior management leadership roles overseeing multi-vessel fleets across PSVs, AHTSVs, FISVs, and crew transfer vessels.
	Proven track record of managing high-value offshore contracts, ensuring compliance with client KPIs, international regulatory frameworks, and safety management systems.
	Extensive experience in multi-jurisdictional regulatory compliance, including ISM, ISPS, SOLAS, MARPOL, NIMASA, and NCDMB statutory requirements.
	Demonstrated expertise in strategic fleet deployment, CAPEX/OPEX budgeting, lifecycle asset management, and predictive maintenance programs.
	Hands-on experience with AI-driven fleet monitoring, digital twin simulations, and advanced operational analytics for performance optimization.


Technical &amp; Operational Competencies:


	Deep understanding of marine vessel dynamics, offshore logistics, propulsion systems, and complex offshore engineering operations.
	Proficiency in modern PMS platforms, fleet management software, and operational decision-support tools.
	Strong capability in incident root-cause analysis, risk assessment, and implementation of continuous improvement programs aligned with international best practices.
	Demonstrated ability to integrate technical, operational, and commercial objectives, translating complex technical information into actionable strategic decisions.


Leadership &amp; Personal Attributes:


	Exceptional leadership skills with proven ability to motivate, mentor, and retain highly skilled marine and technical personnel.
	Outstanding stakeholder management, negotiation, and communication skills, with experience interfacing with government agencies, IOCs, EPCs, and regulatory bodies.
	Strong analytical mindset, strategic foresight, and decision-making under high-risk offshore operational environments.
	Demonstrated integrity, ethical decision-making, and commitment to HSE excellence, regulatory compliance, and organizational reputation.


Other Requirements:


	Willingness and physical readiness for periodic offshore deployment, inspections, audits, and client visits.
	Ability to navigate complex multi-stakeholder operational challenges while maintaining focus on operational efficiency, safety, and regulatory compliance.
	Membership or fellowship in professional maritime or offshore engineering bodies (e.g., Institute of Marine Engineering, Science &amp; Technology (IMarEST), Nigerian Institute of Marine Engineers, or equivalent) is highly advantageous.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV/Resume to:&nbsp;recruitment@stricklandserv.com&nbsp;and copy&nbsp;stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmb.gov.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Executive Assistant Job at Wells Accounting and Tax Services




        
    

        
        Wells Accounting and Tax Services, founded in 2019, is an independent accounting services firm based in Lagos, Nigeria. We provide a range of bookkeeping, payroll, tax, business consulting, and other financial advisory services that empower businesses to scale, through data-driven decision-making. Leveraging more than a decade's worth of diverse industry knowledge plus a team of dedicated professionals, we help you to stay financially organised so that your business remains in business. At Wells Accounting and Tax Services, we create and implement well-tailored accounting solutions that suit the unique needs of your business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant
     

            
    



Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and professional Executive Assistant to provide administrative and operational support to senior management. The ideal candidate will manage schedules, communications, and office coordination while maintaining confidentiality and professionalism at all times.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain executives’ calendars, appointments, and meetings
	Coordinate meetings, prepare agendas, and take accurate minutes
	Handle internal and external correspondence on behalf of management
	Organize travel arrangements, logistics, and itineraries when required
	Maintain proper filing systems (physical and electronic)
	Prepare reports, presentations, and documents as assigned
	Screen calls, emails, and visitors professionally
	Support day-to-day administrative operations of the office
	Ensure confidentiality of sensitive information at all times
	Liaise with staff, clients, and external partners as required


Requirements & Qualifications


	HND/BSc in Business Administration, Secretarial Studies, or related field
	Minimum of 2–3 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role
	Strong written and verbal communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
	Excellent organizational and time-management skills
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure
	Professional appearance and conduct


Skills & Competencies:


	Attention to detail
	Discretion and confidentiality
	Strong interpersonal skills
	Problem-solving ability
	Initiative and reliability


Salary
N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.wells@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Job Position: Front-End &amp; UI/UX Developer (Web, Mobile &amp; Desktop)

Job Location:&nbsp;Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

	We are seeking a highly skilled and creative Front-End Developer with proven UI/UX design expertise to join our technology team. This is a dual-role position that requires strong hands-on experience in both front-end development and UI/UX design.
	The ideal candidate will not only build high-performance, responsive applications but also design intuitive and user-centered interfaces.
	You will be responsible for delivering seamless, engaging experiences across web, mobile, and desktop platforms, turning complex satellite and geospatial data into clear, impactful visual insights.


Key Responsibilities
Front-End Development:


	Design and develop responsive interfaces for web, mobile, and desktop applications using React framework.
	Integrate front-end applications with APIs to deliver real-time satellite imagery, analytics, and insights.
	Optimize applications for cross-platform and cross-browser compatibility, performance, and scalability.
	Conduct unit and integration testing to ensure reliability and functionality.

	Lead and implement UI/UX processes from wireframes to high-fidelity designs.
	Use tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or InVision to create user-centered designs.

	Ensure accessibility, usability, and consistency across all platforms.

	Proven ability to design and deliver high-quality UI/UX using tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or InVision.

	Lead and implement UI/UX processes from wireframes to high-fidelity designs.
	Use tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or InVision to create user-centered designs.
	Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams (GIS analysts, product managers, cybersecurity experts) to translate complex data into intuitive user experiences.
	Ensure accessibility, usability, and consistency across all platforms.

	Work with GIS analysts to design interactive maps, dashboards, and geospatial visualizations.
	Partner with cybersecurity professionals to safeguard front-end applications against vulnerabilities.
	Maintain documentation for design systems, UI components, and integration workflows.
	Stay updated with the latest in front-end frameworks, UI/UX best practices, and emerging design trends.

	Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of professional experience in front-end development with strong, demonstrable UI/UX design expertise.
	Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.js.
	Proven ability to design and deliver high-quality UI/UX using tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or InVision.
	Strong grasp of responsive design, accessibility standards, and user-centered design principles.

	This role is ideal for professionals who are equally passionate about crafting seamless user experiences and building robust, responsive applications.
